intro: Draba kusnetzowii, commonly known as the Kusnetzow's whitlow grass, is a low-growing flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to arctic and alpine regions of Eurasia, including parts of Russia, Scandinavia, and northern Europe. The plant typically produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in tight clusters, and its leaves are narrow and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates. Draba kusnetzowii is often found in tundra and mountainous habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
